channel.title: Hosting my server - Have tried lots of things, what did I forget? (Incl. Images)
channel.description:
Hello!
I started making a server about 4 years ago, but didn't succeed hosting it. Since a couple of days ago I tried to host my server again. Still didn't succeed. With help from pictures I'll try to explain what I did - and maybe I forgot something?
First of all, it might be important to know that I am using [b]a router[/b].
I started by downloading and installing No-IP. On the website I made a new no-ip. This were the settings I used: [img]http://img138.imageshack.us/img138/1142/24597476hj4.png[/img]
After that I went into my No-IP program, and it showt up as following: [img]http://img98.imageshack.us/img98/4605/29064892ss7.png[/img]
Next I went to forward port 5555 and 43594 in my router. Looks as following: [img]http://img237.imageshack.us/img237/8770/54333091le8.png[/img]
Also, I disabled my router's and computer's firewall, just in case it should block anything: [img]http://img338.imageshack.us/img338/4120/51463225kp0.png[/img]
I just want to get the hosting working before I start editing the server to my wants and needs. So I just compiled my server, which returned the following: [img]http://img338.imageshack.us/img338/5787/29814310cj2.png[/img]
As you can see, I also have the most current version of JDK.
After this I launched my server: [img]http://img237.imageshack.us/img237/9850/92298395ik7.png[/img]
Asked a couple of friends to connect, but none of them could connect. All their clients returned: "Error connecting to server, must be down."
What did I do wrong? I hope somebody can help me out.

item.title: Hosting my server - Have tried lots of things, what did I forget? (Incl. Images)
item.dc:creator: @roflmao2 roflmao2
item.description:
@roflmao2 wrote:

I made my static IP correctly now… still it doesn’t work. I’ve got no idea why

Read full topic

item.source: Hosting my server - Have tried lots of things, what did I forget? (Incl. Images)

item.title: Hosting my server - Have tried lots of things, what did I forget? (Incl. Images)
item.dc:creator: @roflmao2 roflmao2
item.description:
@roflmao2 wrote:

[quote=“Runescape Project, post:25, topic:192851”] click this
then this
right click here
advanced then settings


Fill the last one in after you click it make your port 5555 and make sure tcp is in the circle.[/quote]
I’ve got Windows Vista, not xp. Anyway, I went to my Windows Firewall in vista and enabled port 5555 and 43594. Let’s try again

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 26, 2008, 08:59:57 AM[/size][hr][quote=“thoompie, post:26, topic:192851”]You can try to remove all double entries from your routers virtual server(port forwarding) page.
Double entries cause routers to malfunction sometimes, idk if it works, but i would say it’s worth a try! ;)[/quote]
Done, didn’t help.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 26, 2008, 09:10:08 AM[/size][hr]If I try to login on my own server, is it possible to connect with my no-ip?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 26, 2008, 09:48:34 AM[/size][hr]Also, in my router it says something about “DynDNS”, is it worth trying using DynDNS instead of No-IP?

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting my server - Have tried lots of things, what did I forget? (Incl. Images)
item.dc:creator: @thoompie thoompie
item.description:
@thoompie wrote:

You can try to remove all double entries from your routers virtual server(port forwarding) page.
Double entries cause routers to malfunction sometimes, idk if it works, but i would say it’s worth a try!

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting my server - Have tried lots of things, what did I forget? (Incl. Images)
item.dc:creator: @roflmao2 roflmao2
item.description:
@roflmao2 wrote:

If you want me to take pictures of my LAN-settings or anything, just ask ahead. I just want to get this all working.

I am using Port 5555 on my server, because it says: running server on 0.0.0.0:5555 - so I don’t think I’ll have to add 43594.
I hope anybody else has got an idea.

By the way Cultivated, have you looked on my other idea about my Hamachi-IP:
What if I install hamachi, make a server on it, then use my Hamachi IP on No-IP.com and make a no-ip using my hamachi IP.
It works for me now, but do other people have to download Hamachi if I want to do this?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @roflmao2 roflmao2
item.description:
@roflmao2 wrote:

I’ve got one, yeah.

But if I shut it down it doesn’t work either, so that can’t be the problem.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2008, 05:00:33 PM[/size][hr]What I’ve tried is: Forwarded ports, created static IP, turned firewall in router and on my PC off, turned my port forwarding section in my firwall off. Neither of them all didn’t work. I just don’t get it at all

item.dc:creator: @roflmao2 roflmao2
item.description:
@roflmao2 wrote:

My IP-address on www.ipchicken.com has never changed. It has always been the same.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2008, 04:36:41 PM[/size][hr]Some people just did what I did and it works … I just don’t understand why it doesn’t for me.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2008, 04:50:21 PM[/size][hr]Mhm, I think I’ve got an idea.
What if I install hamachi, make a server on it, then use my Hamachi IP on No-IP.com and make a no-ip using my hamachi IP.
It works for me now, but do other people have to download Hamachi if I want to do this?

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting my server - Have tried lots of things, what did I forget? (Incl. Images)
item.dc:creator: @roflmao2 roflmao2
item.description:
@roflmao2 wrote:

I’ve done that now - maybe it will work now

If it works, then can I log in on MY pc where I run the server on with the no-ip server I’ve made?

EDIT: I’ve done that, I can log in on my static IP, which is: 192.168.2.136
I can also log in on my localhost: 127.0.0.1

I cannot login on my no-ip: timmys-server.no-ip.org

I’ve tried turning my firewall off, didn’t work.
I’ve totally got no idea what else I can do …[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2008, 04:29:06 PM[/size][hr]Anybody else who can help me?

I really want to get this working!

Read full topic

@Cultivated wrote:

For your ip, it should be static. (Mine doesn’t work if you put .1, I have to put .136) Maybe that’s whats wrong? (If you need to know how to make a static IP go to: http://portforward.com/networking/staticip.htm
